H0.text: What is the name of the commercial airport which opened in 2005 on the site of the former RAF Finningley. Doncaster Airport

H1.text: What is the name of the commercial airport which opened in 2005 on the site of the former RAF Finningley. Finningley International Airport

H2.text: What is the name of the commercial airport which opened in 2005 on the site of the former RAF Finningley. Sheffield Airport

H3.text: What is the name of the commercial airport which opened in 2005 on the site of the former RAF Finningley. EGCN

A4.text: The airport was opened as Robin Hood Airport Doncaster Sheffield in April 2005.

A6.text: The airfield was developed into an international airport named Doncaster Sheffield Airport, which opened on 28 April 2005.

A7.text: Doncaster Sheffield Airport was formerly named and commonly referred to as Robin Hood Airport.

A8.text: Doncaster Sheffield Airport opened in 2005, handling its last passenger flight in November 2022 after the Peel Group cited it was unlikely to return to profitability.

A9.text: It opened on 28 April 2005 on the former RAF Finningley site and was served mainly by charter and budget airlines, with about one million passengers a year.
